isis.stitle: TSI 98-08-04 - Detroit Diesel Series 60 Engine Overlay Harness

subjectgroup.subject: Detroit Diesel Series 60 Engine Overlay Harness

geninfo.para: 96/97/9800 Models Built Before January 1, 1998, with DDECII and DDECIII Systems may experience harness wire abrasion, when vehicle mileage approaches 400,000.

The following procedure may be performed on vehicles with a history of engine fault codes and the engine harness is considered to be the root cause. This procedure may also be performed as preventive maintenance on vehicles with high mileage to extend engine harness life.

note.para: Refer to circuit diagram book CTS-5120S or CTS-5254V when performing this procedure.

step1.para: Key must be in off position.
Remove cab floor cover to expose harness connectors.
Disconnect cab floor connector (262) containing engine ECM circuits. Connect overlay harness, Part Number 3519932C91, to cab floor connection.
Route the overlay harness around cab hinge bracket. Strap lock the overlay harness to the headlight harness to gain adequate clearance from the cab hinge bracket.
Route the overlay harness with the engine harness and secure the overlay harness every 12 inches with strap locks.
Disconnect 30 position (341) and single position (780) ECM connectors. Connect the overlay connectors to the ECM.
Disconnect the coolant module connector (343). Connect the overlay harness to the coolant module.
Disconnect the engine brake connector (344). Connect the overlay harness to the engine brake.
Disconnect the coolant level sensor (372). Connect the overlay harness to the coolant level sensor.
Disconnect wire 16D at circuit breaker B3. Connect the overlay harness to circuit breaker B3.
Disconnect the speedometer sensor (225). Connect the overlay harness to the speedometer sensor.
Cut off and remove all old (unused) connectors from the engine harness to prevent future usage.

note.para: The engine overlay harness does not contain all engine harness circuits. The overlay harness only contains circuits that are critical to the engine ECM.

step1.para: Key must be in off position.
Remove cab floor cover to expose harness connectors.
Disconnect cab floor connector (262) containing engine ECM circuits. Connect overlay harness, Part Number 3519960C91, to cab floor connection.
Route the overlay harness around cab hinge bracket. Strap lock the overlay harness to the headlight harness to gain adequate clearance from the cab hinge bracket.
Route the overlay harness with the engine harness and secure the overlay harness every 12 inches with strap locks.
Disconnect A/C fan control switch (236). Connect the overlay harness to the connection at the A/C fan control switch.

At fan solenoid connector (227), remove wire 23A (12AWG, ignition feed) from the old connector with an approved terminal removal tool. Insert wire 23A into overlay harness connector cavity A. Connect overlay harness to the fan solenoid.
Disconnect 30 position (341) and single position (780) ECM connectors. Connect the overlay connectors to the ECM.
Disconnect the coolant level sensor (278). Connect the overlay harness to the coolant level sensor.
Disconnect wire 16D at circuit breaker B3. Connect the overlay harness to circuit breaker B3.
Disconnect the speedometer sensor (225). Connect the overlay harness to the speedometer sensor.
Cut off and remove all old (unused) connectors from the engine harness to prevent future usage.
